section.name: Website Configuration
section.span: How to configure a website's modules, layouts and sitemap.
section.p: A website's modules, layouts and sitemap are configured through the Console application. The Console application provides direct access to the contents of Hippo Repository. Among that content is the website's configuration. The screenshot below shows the repository contents for a typical project. The website configuration is under the hst:configuration node (highlighted in the screenshot).

img.alt: The hst:configuration node in the repository

section.p: Under the second hst:configuration node, you will find four nodes:
Each of these nodes will be explained in detail in the following subsections.

subsection.name: hst:modules
subsection.p: The hst:modules node contains child nodes that represent modules. Each child node defines for a module the location of its JSP, and possibly other parameters that this particular modules accepts (e.g. the location of a document in the repository).

img.alt: The hst:modules node in the repository

subsection.p: When you want to add a module to your website, add a new child node to hst:modules. The node type should be hst:module. Add at least the required properties in the following list:

tr.td: The location of the module's JSP file, e.g. modules/newslist.jsp
The repository path to the content this module displays, e.g. /content/news

subsection.name: hst:sitemap
subsection.p: The hst:sitemap node contains child nodes that represent sitemap items. Each child node defines for a sitemap item which URL(s) it is mapped to, which layout it uses, and which modules are placed in the layout's containers.

img.alt: The hst:sitemap node in the repository

subsection.p: When you want to add a sitemap item, add a new child node to hst:sitemap. The node type should be hst:sitemapitem. Add at least the required properties in the following list:

tr.td: A URL, e.g. /home, or a group of URLs covered by a regular expression, e.g. /news/(.*?)$
The layout this sitemap item uses. Refers to a layout node under hst:layouts, e.g. hst:layouts/homepage.

subsection.p: The sitemap item must define for each container in its layout, one or modules. Therefore the sitemap item node must have a child node of type hst:sitemaplayout for each of the layout's containers (as defined for that layout under hst:layouts). Each node must have a property hst:layoutAttribute, that refers to a container.

tr.td: Refers to a container in the used layout, e.g. leftcolumn.

subsection.p: To place a module inside a container, add a child node of type hst:sitemapmodule to the sitemaplayout node. The module to use is specified in the property hst:module:

tr.td: The module to place in the container defined by the parent node. Refers to a module node under hst:modules.

subsection.name: hst:layouts
subsection.p: The hst:layouts node contains child nodes that represent layouts. Each child node defines for a layout the location of its corresponding JSP file, and its containers (placeholders for modules).

img.alt: The hst:layouts node in the repository

subsection.p: When you want to add a layout, add a new child node to hst:layouts. The node type should be hst:layout. Specify the location of the layout's JSP file in the property hst:template:

tr.td: The location of the template's JSP file, e.g. templates/threecolumn.jsp

subsection.p: A layout node (of type hst:layout), has a child node of type hst:layoutitem for each of its containers. These child nodes have no properties, but each of them must have a corresponding hst-tmpl:container tag in the layout's JSP file.
